sen.j: 古墳（こふん）とは、一般には墳丘を持つ古い墓のことである。
sen.e: A Kofun generally refers to old grave which has tumulus.
A kofun generally refers to old grave which has a tumulus.
A kofun generally refers to old grave which has a tumulus.

sen.j: 古代の東洋では位の高い者や権力者の墓として盛んに築造された。
sen.e: In the East a lot of Kofun were constructed as graves of powerful persons in ancient times.
In the East a lot of kofun were constructed as graves of powerful people in ancient times.
In the East a lot of kofun were constructed as graves of powerful people in ancient times.

sen.j: 日本史では、3世紀後半から7世紀前半に築造されたものを特に「古墳」と呼び、それ以外の時代につくられた墳丘を持つ墓は墳丘墓と呼んで区別している。
sen.e: In history of Japan, especially tumuluses constructed between the third century and the seventh century are referred to as 'Kofun' and other tumuluses constructed in other period are referred to as funkyubo (grave mound or tumulus).

In Japanese history, tumuluses constructed between the third and seventh centuries are particularly referred to as 'kofun' and other tumuluses constructed in other periods are referred to as funkyubo (grave mound or tumulus).
sen.cmt: Wording. I also changed "history of Japan" to "Japanese history" despite it being the standard translation. Please check that this is ok.
sen.e: In Japanese history, tumuluses constructed between the third and seventh centuries are particularly referred to as 'kofun' and other tumuluses constructed in other periods are referred to as funkyubo (grave mound or tumulus).

sen.j: 松本豊胤によるとため池造成や水田経営を積極的に進めた豪族たちがその墓所である古墳を開発した地域を望む場所に造営していったとしている。
sen.e: According to Toyotane MATSUMOTO, Gozoku (local ruling family) who constructed irrigation pond and actively managed rice paddies constructed their graves at the places from where people can see the territory developed by them.

According to Toyotane MATSUMOTO, gozoku (local ruling family) who constructed irrigation ponds and actively managed rice paddies, constructed their graves at places from where people can see the territory they developed.

According to Toyotane MATSUMOTO, gozoku (local ruling family) who constructed irrigation ponds and actively managed rice paddies, constructed their graves at places from where people can see the territory they developed.

sen.j: 古墳は規模や化粧方法の違いとともにその平面形状によってと、さらに埋葬の中心施設である主体部の構造や形態によって細かく分類編年されている。
sen.e: Kofun is chronologically and particularly classified into several types based on size, decoration, planar shape and construction and shape of the main part as the most important part of entombment.

Kofun is chronologically and particularly classified into several types based on size, decoration, surface shape along with the construction and shape of the main part, which is the most important part of entombment.

Kofun is chronologically and particularly classified according to the size, decoration, surface shape, as well as the construction and shape of the main part, which is the most important part of entombment.
sen.cmt: into several types based on･･･ですが、本文には「いくつかの種類に」という内容はなかったので、修正致しました。

sen.j: 墳丘の築造にあたっては、盛り土部分を堅固にするため砂質土や粘性土を交互につき固める版築工法で築成されるものも多いこと、こうした工法は飛鳥時代や奈良時代に大規模な建物の基礎を固める工法として広く使用されていることが、修繕時の調査などで判明している。
sen.e: For construction of most tumulus, sandy soil and cohesive soil were alternately tamped down and the method called hanchiku method (a method of making the core of a podium), this method was used to make banking part harder, according to surveys which were conducted during repair of building of Asuka and Nara Period, the method was generally used to develop a solid base of big building in ancient time.

For construction of most tumulus, sandy soil and cohesive soil were alternately tamped down using method called the hanchiku method (a method of making the core of a podium). This method was used to make the banking part harder, and according to surveys which were conducted during the repair of buildings of the Asuka and Nara periods, the method was generally used to develop a solid base of large buildings in ancient times.

For construction of most tumulus, sandy soil and cohesive soil were alternately tamped down using method called the hanchiku method (a method of making the core of a podium), which was used to make the banking part harder, and according to surveys which were conducted during the repair of buildings of the Asuka and Nara periods, the method was generally used to develop a solid base of large buildings in ancient times.
sen.cmt: 一訳文となるよう修正致しました。

sen.j: 古墳は、規模・形状、およびその他の要素において、弥生時代の墓制にとって変わったものでなく、非常な変化した墓制としてあらわれた。
sen.e: Considering size, shape and other aspects of Kofun, it is clear that Kofun is not replacement of graves of Yayoi Period, but Kofun was institution of tombing which changed so much.
Considering size, shape and other aspects of a kofun, it is clear that a kofun is not a replacement for graves of the Yayoi period, rather an institution of tombing which has greatly changed.
Considering size, shape and other aspects of a kofun, it is clear that a kofun is not a replacement for graves of the Yayoi period, rather an institution of tombing which has greatly changed.

sen.j: それは、特定のわずかな人たちの埋葬法であり、同時代の集団構成員の墓と著しく隔絶したものである。
sen.e: Kofun were burial methods for few specific people and very differ from graves of other constituent members in a group at that time.
A kofun was burial method for a few specific people and differ greatly from graves of other constituent member-groups at that time.
A kofun was burial method for a few specific people and differ greatly from graves of other constituent member-groups at that time.

sen.j: さらに、地域的にも不均等に出現する。
sen.e: In addition, Kofun can be seen unequally at many places.
In addition, kofun can be seen unequally in many places.
In addition, kofun can be seen unequally in many places.

sen.j: すなわち、古墳の発生は、墓制の単なる変化や葬送観念の変化にととどまらず、社会・政治の全般に関わる問題としてあらわれたのである。
sen.e: More specifically, origin of Kofun was not just a change of institution of tombing or funereal conception but also an issue related to society and politics in general.
More specifically, the origins of kofun show that they were not just a change in institution of tombing or funereal conception but also an issue related to society and politics in general.
More specifically, the origins of kofun show that they were not just a change in institution of tombing or funereal conception but also an issue related to society and politics in general.

sen.j: 古墳発生の問題は、戦前から議論されていた。
sen.e: Regarding origin of Kofun, there was argument before the WW Ⅱ.
There have been disputes regarding the origins of kofun since before World War 2.
There have been disputes regarding the origins of kofun since before World War II.
sen.cmt: World War 2を用語統一に基づき修正致しました。

sen.j: その中で、この問題を日本古代国家の形成途上における政治史の課題として位置づけたのは小林行雄であった。
sen.e: Yukio KOBAYASHI considered the issue as political issue at the time of development of ancient sate in Japan.
Yukio KOBAYASHI considered the issue as one of political history concerning the period of the development of the ancient state of Japan.
Yukio KOBAYASHI considered the issue as one of political history concerning the period of the development of the ancient state of Japan.

sen.j: 具体的には、伝世鏡論と同笵鏡論を展開した。
sen.e: Specifically he offered two theories, Densei-kyo mirror ron and Dohan-kyo mirror ron.
He specifically offers two theories - Densei-kyo mirror ron and Dohan-kyo mirror ron.
sen.cmt: Wording. Please check the red text.
sen.e: He specifically offers two theories - Densei-kyo mirror theory and Dohan-kyo mirror theory.
sen.cmt: OKただし、ronをtheoryに変更しました。

sen.j: この両論に疑問を表明したのは後藤守一、原田大六、森浩一、伝世鏡論に疑問や同笵鏡の分有関係の解釈について斎藤忠、系統的・理論的に批判した内藤晃、鏡の賜与だけをもって大和政権と地方首長との政治関係の成立を考察するのは困難とする西嶋定生などがいた。
sen.e: About the two theories, Shuichi GOTO, Dairoku HARADA and Koichi MORI raised questions, Tadashi SAITO posed question regarding Densei-kyo mirror ron and explanation of the fact that Dohan-kyo mirrors were owned by more than one owner, Akira NAITO criticized the theories systematically and theoretically, Sadao NISHIJIMA insisted that establishment of politics relationship between Yamato Administration and heads of local governments can not be explained only accordance of mirrors only.

Shuichi GOTO, Dairoku HARADA and Koichi MORI raised questions regarding the two theories, Tadashi SAITO posed questions regarding Densei-kyo mirror ron and the explanation of the fact that Dohan-kyo mirrors were owned by more than one owner, Akira NAITO criticized the theories systematically and theoretically, Sadao NISHIJIMA insisted that the establishment of a political relationship between the YAMATO Administration and heads of local governments cannot be explained only in accordance of mirrors.
sen.cmt: Wording. Please check the red text.
sen.e: Shuichi GOTO, Dairoku HARADA and Koichi MORI raised questions regarding the two theories, Tadashi SAITO posed questions regarding Densei-kyo mirror ron and the explanation of the fact that Dohan-kyo mirrors were owned by more than one owner, Akira NAITO criticized the theories systematically and theoretically, Sadao NISHIJIMA insisted that the establishment of a political relationship between the YAMATO Administration and heads of local governments cannot be explained only in accordance of mirrors.

tit.cmt: 「数」の訳が必要かと考え、追記致しました。

sen.j: 日本の古墳所在件数が最も多いのは兵庫県で16,577基にのぼる。
sen.e: In Japan Hyogo Prefecture has the most Kofun and there are 16,577.
Hyogo Prefecture has the most kofun in Japan with 16,577,
With 16,577 tumulses, Hyogo Prefecture has the largest number of kofun in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一訳文となるよう修正致しました。また日本語の内容がより反映される文に書き換えました。

sen.j: 以下、千葉県13,112基、鳥取県13,094基、福岡県11,311基、京都府11,310基とつづき、全国合計では161,560基となる（平成13年3月末 文化庁調べ）。
sen.e: Followed by Chiba Prefecture 13,112, Tottori Prefecture 13,094, Fukuoka Prefecture 11,311 and Kyoto Prefecture 11,310, nationwide there are 161,560 in total (according a survey by the Agency for Cultural Affairs, at the end of March in 2001)

followed by Chiba Prefecture with 13,112, Tottori Prefecture with 13,094, Fukuoka Prefecture with 11,311 and Kyoto Prefecture with 11,310. Nationwide, there are a total of 161,560 kofun (according to a survey carried out by the Agency for Cultural Affairs at the end of March in 2001).
sen.cmt: PLEASE NOTE - I think this sentence and the sentence above should read as one, thus have started this sentence with a small "f" for "followed", and ended the previous sentence with a comma.
sen.e: This is followed by Chiba Prefecture with 13,112, Tottori Prefecture with 13,094, Fukuoka Prefecture with 11,311, Kyoto Prefecture with 11,310 tumulses, and nationwide, there are a total of 161,560 kofun (according to a survey carried out by the Agency for Cultural Affairs at the end of March in 2001).
sen.cmt: 一文一訳文、また日本語の内容がより反映される文に書き換えました。

sen.j: 日本の古墳には、基本的な形の円墳・方墳をはじめ、八角墳（野口王墓）・双方中円墳（櫛山古墳・楯築古墳）などの種類がある。
sen.e: In Japan there are basic shape Kofun such as a round barrow and square tumulus, and also other shapes including Hakkaku-fun (octagonal tumulus) (Noguchino Ono-haka) and candy-wrap (keyhole shape with one more handle) shape mound (Kushiyama Kofun and Tatetsuki Kofun).

The basic shapes of kofun in Japan are the round barrow shape and square tumulus. Other shapes include the hakkaku-fun (octagonal tumulus) (Noguchino Ono-haka) and candy-wrap (keyhole shape with one more handle) shape mound (Kushiyama Kofun and Tatetsuki Kofun).

Beginning with the round barrow shape and square tumulus which are the basic shapes, there are many kinds of kofun such as hakkaku-fun (octagonal tumulus) (Noguchino Ono-haka) and candy-wrap (keyhole shape with one more handle) shape mound (Kushiyama Kofun and Tatetsuki Kofun).
sen.cmt: 一訳文となるよう修正致しました。また日本語の内容がより反映される文に書き換えました。

sen.j: また、前方後円墳・前方後方墳・双円墳・双方墳などの山が二つある古墳もある。
sen.e: In addition, there are zenpo-koen (keyhole-shaped tomb) mound, zenpo-koho (square front, square back) mound, soen (double round) shape mound and soho (double square) shape mound which have two tumulus.

In addition, there are the zenpo-koen (keyhole-shaped tomb) mound, zenpo-koho (square front, square back) mound, soen (double round) shape mound and soho (double square) shape mound, which all have two tumuli.

sen.j: 主要な古墳は、山が二つあるタイプの古墳であることが多い。
sen.e: Major Kofun usually have two tumulus.
Major kofun usually have two tumuli.
Major kofun usually have two tumuli.

sen.j: 死者が葬られる埋葬施設には、様々な形状が見られる。
sen.e: There are a lot of different shape of mortuary spaces where the dead were entombed.
There are many different shapes of mortuary spaces where the dead are entombed.
There are many different shapes of mortuary spaces where the dead are entombed.

sen.j: 前方後円墳の代表的な古墳は、大阪府堺市の大山（大仙）古墳である。
sen.e: A representative of zenpo-koen (keyhole-shaped tomb) mound is Daisen (大山 also written as 大仙) Kofun in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.
A representative of a zenpo-koen (keyhole-shaped tomb) mound is Daisen (大山 also written as 大仙) Kofun in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.
A representative of a zenpo-koen (keyhole-shaped tomb) mound is Daisen (大山 also written as 大仙) Kofun in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 多くの古墳は築かれてから長い時間が経過したため、上に木が生えている事が多いが、建造当時の木のない状態が多くの古墳の本来の姿である。
sen.e: Because long time past since constructions, most of Kofun have trees on them but the true state of a Kofun at the time of completion was without trees.
Because such a long time has passed since their construction, most kofun have trees growing on them, but the true state of a kofun at the time of completion was without trees.
Because such a long time has passed since their construction, most kofun have trees growing on them, but the true state of a kofun at the time of completion was without trees.

sen.j: 五色塚古墳や森将軍塚古墳のように元の状態に復元された例もある。
sen.e: For example, Goshikizuka Kofun and Mori shogunzuka Kofun were restored to the true states.
Such examples are Goshiki-zuka Kofun and Mori Shogun-zuka Kofun, which have both been restored to their original states.
Such examples are Goshiki-zuka Kofun and Mori Shogun-zuka Kofun, which have both been restored to their original states.

sen.j: 古墳に用いられる埋葬施設には、竪穴系のものと横穴系のものとがある。
sen.e: There are two types of mortuary spaces of Kofun, pit type and horizontal tunnel type.
There are two types of mortuary spaces of kofun - pit type and horizontal tunnel type.
There are two types of mortuary spaces of kofun - pit type and horizontal tunnel type.

sen.j: 竪穴系のものは、築造された墳丘の上から穴を掘り込み（墓坑 ぼこう）、その底に棺を据え付けて埋め戻したものである。
sen.e: About the pit type, a hole was made from the surface of a tumulus (Boko, a tunnel to put a coffin), then put a coffin at the bottom and fill sand again.
The pit type consisted of a hole which was made from the surface of a tumulus called a Boko (a tunnel to put a coffin in), where a coffin was placed at the bottom, and filled with sand again.
The pit type consisted of a hole which was made from the surface of a tumulus called a Boko (a tunnel to put a coffin in), where a coffin was placed at the bottom, and filled with sand again.

sen.j: 基本的にその構造から追葬はできず、埋葬施設内に人が活動するような空間はない。
sen.e: Becaise of the structure, an added burrial was impossible and there was no space where people move around.
Because of the structure, an added burrial was impossible, and there was no space where people were able to move around.
Because of the structure, an added burial was impossible, and there was no space where people were able to move around.
sen.cmt: スペリングを修正致しました。

sen.j: 竪穴式石槨、粘土槨、箱式石棺、木棺直葬などがある。
sen.e: There are pit type sekkaku (stone surrounding wooden coffin), nendokaku (clay surrounding wooden coffin), hakoshiki-sekkan stone coffin and wooden coffin.
There are pit-type sekkaku (stone surrounding wooden coffins), nendokaku (clay surrounding wood coffins), and hakoshiki-sekkan stone coffins and wood coffins.
There are pit-type sekkaku (stone surrounding wooden coffins), nendokaku (clay surrounding wood coffins), and hakoshiki-sekkan stone coffins and wood coffins.

sen.j: このうち、竪穴式石槨は、墓坑の底に棺を設置したあと、周囲に石材を積み上げて壁とし、その上から天井石を載せたものである。
sen.e: For the pit type sekkaku, after placing a wooden coffin at the bottom, stones (building stone) are built up as walls and then a ceiling stone is placed as a cover.
Regarding the pit-type sekkaku, after placing a wooden coffin at the bottom, stones (building stone) are built up as walls and then ceiling stone is placed as a cover.
Regarding the pit-type sekkaku, after placing a wooden coffin at the bottom, stones (building stone) are built up as walls and then ceiling stone is placed as a cover.

sen.j: 古墳時代前期から中期に盛行する。
sen.e: The style was popular from the beginning to middle of Kofun Period (tumulus period).
The style was popular from the beginning to the middle of the Kofun period (tumulus period).
The style was popular from the beginning to the middle of the Kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: 粘土槨は、墓坑底の木棺を粘土で何重にもくるんだもので、竪穴式石槨の簡略版とされる。
sen.e: For nendokaku, a wooden coffin was wrapped in layers of clay and this is considered as a brief version of pit type sekkaku.
For nendokaku, a wooden coffin was wrapped in layers of clay which is considered a brief version of a pit-type sekkaku.
For nendokaku, a wooden coffin placed at the bottom was wrapped in layers of clay which is considered a brief version of a pit-type sekkaku.
sen.cmt: 「墓坑底の」の訳が抜けておりましたので追記致しました。

sen.j: 古墳時代前期中頃から中期にかけて盛行した。
sen.e: This was popular from the middle of the beginning and middle of Kofun Period.
This was popular from the middle of the beginning/middle of the Kofun period.
This was popular from the middle of the beginning/middle of the Kofun period.

sen.j: 箱式石棺は、板状の石材で遺骸のまわりを箱状に囲いこむもので縄文時代以来の埋葬法である。
sen.e: Hakoshiki-sekkan was to make enclosure with stones around the dead body like a box, and this is the burial method from Jomon Period.
Hakoshiki-sekkan consisted of making an enclosure with stones around the dead body like a box, and is the burial method from the Jomon period.
Hakoshiki-sekkan consisted of making an enclosure with stones around the dead body like a box, and is the burial method from the Jomon period.

sen.j: 木棺直葬は、墓坑内に顕著な施設をつくらずに木棺を置いただけのもので、弥生時代以来の埋葬法である。
sen.e: Wooden coffin was just to put a wooden coffin and make no facilities in a tunnel, this is also the burial method from Yayoi Period.
The wooden coffin method was to simply place a wooden coffin and make no space in the tunnel. This is a burial method from the Yayoi period.
The wooden coffin method was to simply place a wooden coffin and make no space in the tunnel; this is a burial method from the Yayoi period.
sen.cmt: 一訳文でないため、セミコロンでつなげました。

sen.j: 横穴式系のものは、地上面もしくは墳丘築造途上の面に構築され、その上に墳丘が作られる。
sen.e: Regarding the type which has horizontal tunnel, a mortuary spaces is built at the ground or at a surface during construction of a tumulus and then the tumulus is built on it.
As for the types which have horizontal tunnels, mortuary spaces are built on the ground or on a surface during construction of a tumulus and the tumulus is then built on it.
As for the types which have horizontal tunnels, mortuary spaces are built on the ground or on a surface during construction of a tumulus and the tumulus is then built on it.

sen.j: 横穴式石室、横口式石槨などがある。
sen.e: There are types including a Yokoana-shiki sekishitsu (horizontal stone chamber) and Yokoguchi-shiki Sekkaku (Stone Sarcophagus with Side Entrance).
Other types include Yokoana-shiki sekishitsu (horizontal stone chamber) and Yokoguchi-shiki sekkaku (stone sarcophagus with side entrance).
Other types include Yokoana-shiki sekishitsu (horizontal stone chamber) and Yokoguchi-shiki sekkaku (stone sarcophagus with side entrance).

sen.j: 横穴式石室は、通路である羨道（せんどう）部と埋葬用の空間である玄室（げんしつ）部を持つ。
sen.e: For Yokoana-shiki sekishitsu, there are a tunnel part as a passage (called Sendo) and a room part for entombment (called Genshitsu).
Yokoana-shiki sekishitsu consists of a tunnel part as a passage (called sendo) and a room part for entombment (called genshitsu).
Yokoana-shiki sekishitsu consists of a tunnel part as a passage (called sendo) and a room part for entombment (called genshitsu).

sen.j: 石室を上から見たとき、羨道が玄室の中央につけられているものを両袖式、羨道が玄室の左右のどちらかに寄せて付けられているものを片袖式と呼ぶ。
sen.e: When looking at the rock chamber from above, if the passage is located at the center of burial chamber, it is called Ryosode-shiki and if the passage is located toward right side or left side, it is called Katasode-shiki.

When looking at the rock chamber from above, if the passage is located at the center of the burial chamber, it is called Ryosode-shiki and if the passage is located toward right side or left side, it is called Katasode-shiki.

sen.j: 玄室内に安置される棺は、石棺・木棺・乾漆棺など様々である。
sen.e: There are variety of coffin types, such as a stone coffin, wooden coffin and kanshitsu (dry lacquered) coffin.
There are variety of coffin types, such as stone coffins, wooden coffins and kanshitsu (dry lacquered) coffins.
There are a variety of coffin types, such as stone coffins, wooden coffins and kanshitsu (dry lacquered) coffins.

sen.j: 玄室への埋葬終了後に羨道は閉塞石（積み石）や扉石でふさがれるが、それを空ければ追葬が可能であった。
sen.e: After an entombment, the passage is blocked by Heisokuishi (piled stones) or Tobiraishi (door stone), but added burial is possible when the block is removed.

sen.j: 古墳時代後期以降に盛行する。
sen.e: This method became popular from the late Kofun Period.
This method became popular from the late Kofun period.

sen.j: 横口式石槨は、本来石室内に置かれていた石棺が単体で埋葬施設となったもので、古墳時代終末期に多く見られる。
sen.e: Yokoguchi-shiki sekkaku was originally a stone coffin which was placed in a rock chamber and the stone coffin itself became a mortuary space, there are a lot of this type at the end of Kofun Period.

sen.j: 古墳時代には、死者を棺に入れて埋葬した。
sen.e: In Kofun Period, a dead body was placed in coffin and then buried.
In the Kofun period, a dead body was placed in a coffin and then buried.
In the Kofun period, a dead body was placed in a coffin and then buried.

sen.j: 棺の材料によって、木棺、石棺、陶棺などがある。
sen.e: There are wooden, stone and celamic coffin depending on materials.
There were wooden, stone and ceramic coffins, etc. depending on the materials.
There were wooden, stone and ceramic coffins and so on depending on the materials used.

sen.j: 木棺のうち刳りぬき式のものは、巨木を縦に二つに割って、それぞれ内部を刳りぬき、蓋と身とが作られたものと考えられ、「割竹式木棺」と呼び習わされている。
sen.e: A hollowed out wooden coffin is called 'Sakitake-shiki mottkan (split bamboo type wooden coffin)' and made of a big tree which is divided into two pieces, then inside of the both pieces is hollowed out and the pieces became a cover and body.
sen.cmt: ※割竹式木棺: 定訳不明です。
sen.e: A hollowed out wooden coffin is called a "Sakitake-shiki mokkan" (split bamboo type wooden coffin) and made of a big tree which is divided into two pieces. The inside of both pieces is then hollowed out and became a cover and body of the coffin.

A hollowed out wooden coffin is called a "Sakitake-shiki mokkan" (split bamboo type wooden coffin) and made of a big tree which is divided into two pieces; the inside of both pieces is then hollowed out and became a cover and body of the coffin.
sen.cmt: 一訳文でないため、セミコロンでつなげました。

sen.j: しかし、巨木を二つに割るというが、竹を二つに割るように簡単にはいかないので用語として適切かどうかを指摘する向きもある。
sen.e: However the term, Sakitake-shiki might be inappropriate because a bamboo can be spilt easily but a big tree can not be spilt like bamboo.
However, the term "Sakitake-shiki" might be inappropriate because a big tree cannot be easily spilt like bamboo.
However, the term "Sakitake-shiki" might be inappropriate because a big tree cannot be easily spilt like bamboo.

sen.j: つぎに「組合式」といわれる木棺は、蓋、底、左右の側板、計四枚の長方形の板と、前後の方形の小口板、時には別に仕切り板が付くこともあるが、二枚とを組み合わせて作った。
sen.e: Then, a wooden coffin type called 'combinational type' consists of 4 rectangle-shaped panels, a cover, bottom part, side plates for right and left side, and two square-shaped small panels, sometimes there is additional panels as partition.

A wooden coffin type called "combinational type" consists of four rectangle-shaped panels, a cover, bottom part, side plates for the right and left sides, and two small square-shaped panels. There are sometimes additional panels used as partitions.

A wooden coffin type called "combinational type" consists of four rectangle-shaped panels, a cover, bottom part, side plates for the right and left sides, and two small square-shaped panels, which are sometimes used as partitions.

tit.cmt: ※厚葬: 定訳不明です。Luxurious funeral と訳出しました。
I think "extravagant" is a better translation.

sen.j: 中国には、埋葬に関して薄葬と厚葬という二つの対立する考え方があった。
sen.e: In China there are two opponent thought about funeral, simple funeral and luxurious funeral.
In China, there are two opposing thoughts about funerals, simple funerals and extravagant funerals.
In China, there are two opposing thoughts about funerals, simple funerals and extravagant funerals.

sen.j: その考え方の違いの根底には異なった死生観が存在していた。
sen.e: Those two thought were based on different view of life and death.
These two thoughts were based on different views of life and death.
These two thoughts were based on different views of life and death.

sen.j: 墳丘を造っているかどうかで、薄葬（はくそう）か厚葬（こうそう）かの違いを区別することができる。
sen.e: To distinguish simple funeral from luxurious funeral, people have to check if there is a tumulus or not.
To distinguish simple funerals from extravagant funerals, people have to check if there is a tumulus or not.
To distinguish simple funerals from extravagant funerals, people have to check if there is a tumulus or not.

sen.j: つまり、死後、墓とした土地を永久に占有できるかどうかで区別する。
sen.e: I fact, if it is luxurious funeral, the dead men can occupy the land forever, this is key point to distinguish.
In fact, a key distinguishing point is that if it is an extravagant funeral, the dead person can occupy the land forever.
In fact, a key distinguishing point is that if it is an extravagant funeral, the dead person can occupy the land forever.

sen.j: 薄葬令
sen.e: The Law of Funeral
The Laws of Funerals
sen.cmt: I made law and funeral both plurals.
sen.e: The Laws of Funerals

sen.j: 646年（大化2年）に出された詔は、長文であり、内容から4部に分けられるが、その第一に述べられているのが、この「薄葬の詔」である。
sen.e: In 646, a long imperial edict was issued and the imperial edict can be divided into 4 parts based on the contents, the part stated at the top is 'The Law of Funeral'.
In 646, a long Imperial edict was issued which is divided into four parts based on the contents. The part stated at the top is "The Laws of Funerals".
In 646, a long Imperial edict was issued which is divided into four parts based on the contents, and the part stated at the top is "The Laws of Funerals".

sen.j: 初めの部分は制定の意義を述べている。
sen.e: At the beginning, values of the law are stated.
At the beginning, the values of the laws are stated.
At the beginning, the values of the laws are stated.

sen.j: 中国の文献を適当に混ぜ合わせて作文している。
sen.e: The statement was made from literatures from China.
The edict was made from Chinese literature.
sen.cmt: Wording. I also changed "statement" to "edict". Please check that this is correct.
sen.e: The edict was made from Chinese literature.

sen.j: 後半は、葬制の内容を具体的に記している。
sen.e: Contents of a funeral are specifically stated at the last half.
The contents of a funeral are specifically stated in the last half.
The contents of a funeral are specifically stated in the last half.

sen.j: 従来の墓の規模を遙かに縮小し、簡素化している。
sen.e: This is to make sizes of traditional graves smaller and simplify.
This is to make the size of a traditional grave smaller and simplified.
sen.cmt: Wording. This sentence is a little hard to understand in the overall context. Please check that it is ok.
sen.e: This is to make the size of a traditional grave smaller and simplified.

sen.j: そこで一般にこの葬制を「薄葬制」という。
sen.e: Therefore the funeral style encouraged here called 'Hakusousei (a simple funeral)'.
Therefore, the funeral style encouraged here is called "Hakusousei" (a simple funeral).
sen.cmt: Wording. As like the above sentence, it is difficult to grasp the context of this sentence. Please check that it is ok.
sen.e: Therefore, the funeral style encouraged here is generally called "Hakusousei" (a simple funeral).
sen.cmt: 「一般に」の訳が見当たりませんでしたので、追記致しました。

sen.j: この法令が出された背景には、「公地公民制」と関わりがあるのではないかという説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that the background of the edict is related to Kochi Komin sei (system of complete state ownership of land and citizens).
There is a theory that the background of the edict is related to Kochi Komin sei (a system of complete state ownership of land and citizens).
There is a theory that the background of the edict is related to Kochi Komin sei (a system of complete state ownership of land and citizens).

sen.j: 日本列島で大規模な古墳が築造された3世紀半ば過ぎから7世紀後半にかけての時期には、朝鮮半島でも墳丘をもつ古墳が盛んに造営された。
sen.e: Between the middle of third century and the late of seventh century, a lot of major Kofun were constructed in Japan, and in Korea at this time, a lot of Kofun which have tumulus were constructed.
Between the middle of the third century and the late seventh century, a lot of major kofun were constructed in Japan, and at this time in Korea, a lot of kofun which have tumuli were constructed.
Between the middle of the third century and the late seventh century, a lot of major kofun were constructed in Japan, and at this time in Korea, a lot of kofun which have tumuli were constructed.

sen.j: 中世では城郭として活用された古墳もあって、一部改変された古墳（黒塚古墳）などがもある。
sen.e: In medieval period, some Kofun were used as castles and some parts of a Kofun were changed (for ex. Kurozuka Kofun).
In the Medieval period, some kofun were used as castles and some parts of a kofun were changed (e.g. Kurozuka Kofun).
In the Medieval period, some kofun were used as castles and some parts of a kofun were changed (e.g. Kurozuka Kofun).

sen.j: 高句麗で最大の古墳は中国集安（しゅうあん）の大王陵である。
sen.e: The biggest Kofun in Goguryeo is Daioryo in Shuan City, China.
The biggest Kofun in Goguryeo is Daioryo in Shuan City, China.
The biggest Kofun in Goguryeo is Daioryo in Shuan City, China.

sen.j: 方形の積石塚で一辺63メートル、周りには一辺320メートルの土塁が巡らされている。
sen.e: This is a square tumulus made of piled stones and 63 meters on a side, around the tumulus there is a dorui (earthen walls) 320 meters on a side.
This is a square tumulus made of piled stones with a length of 63 meters on one side. Around the tumulus there is a dorui (earthen walls for fortification) with a length of 320 on one side.
sen.cmt: Wording. Please check that the translation of "一辺" is correct.
sen.e: This is a square tumulus made of piled stones with a length of 63 meters on each side, and around the tumulus, there is a dorui (earthen walls for fortification) with a length of 320 meters on each side.
sen.cmt: 320の後にmetersが抜けていたので追記致しました。また、一訳文になるよう修正致しました。

sen.j: また平壌の江西（こうせい）大墓は7世紀の壁画古墳として有名である。
sen.e: In addition, Kosei taibo in Pyongyang is famous for wall painting of the seventh century.
In addition, Kosei Taibo in Pyongyang is famous for wall paintings of the seventh century.
In addition, Kosei Taibo in Pyongyang is famous for wall paintings of the seventh century.

sen.j: 一辺60メートルの方墳。
sen.e: This is a square tumulus 60 meters on a side.
This is a square tumulus with a side length of 60 meters.
This is a square tumulus with a side length of 60 meters.

tit.cmt: I think this would change depending on the context.

sen.j: 日本では仁徳天皇陵など皇室の墓所と比定されている多くの古墳は現在宮内庁の管理下にあり発掘調査許可がなかなか下りない事が考古学研究が遅れる要因の一つとなっている。
sen.e: In Japan a lot of Kofun including The Emperor Nintoku Mausoleum are considered as graveyards of Imperial family and under control of Imperial Household Agency, then excavation and research are not permitted easily, this is a reason of delayed archaeological study.

In Japan a lot of kofun including the Emperor Nintoku Mausoleum which are considered as graveyards of the Imperial Family and under control of the Imperial Household Agency, and thus, excavation and research are not easily permitted. This is one of the reasons for delayed archaeological study.

In Japan a lot of kofun including the Emperor Nintoku Mausoleum which are considered as graveyards of the Imperial Family are under control of the Imperial Household Agency; thus, excavation and research are not easily permitted, and this is one of the reasons for delayed archaeological study.
sen.cmt: Imperial Familyのあとはandではなくareが正しいと判断いたしました。また一訳文となるよう修正致しました。

sen.j: なお「○○天皇陵」といった呼称は、江戸時代の儒学者、国学者などの手による文献研究を踏襲し、明治時代に宮内省が比定しただけである。
sen.e: In addition, the names like 'Emperor's tomb' were just determined in Meiji Period based on the literature study by Confucian scholars and scholars of Japanese classical literature in Edo Period.
In addition, names such as "Emperor's Tomb" were determined in the Meiji period based on literature study by Confucian scholars and scholars of Japanese classical literature in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: Wording. I changed "Period" to "period" as per instructions; however, Meiji Period and Edo Period are often written with a capital "p".
sen.e: In addition, names such as "Emperor's Tomb" were determined in the Meiji period based on literature study by Confucian scholars and scholars of Japanese classical literature in the Edo period.

sen.j: その後のめざましい考古学研究の進展により緻密な編年作業が進展し、考古学者の比定と齟齬が生じているものも見られる。
sen.e: In accordance with remarkable progress in archaeological study, detailed chronological study have progressed, so there are some contradiction between estimation by archaeologist and result of the study.
sen.cmt: ※編年作業はchronological studyとして訳出しました。
sen.e: In accordance with remarkable progress in archaeological study, detailed chronological studies have progressed, and so there are some contradictions between estimations by archaeologist and results of studies.

In accordance with remarkable progress in archaeological study, detailed chronological studies have progressed, and so there are some contradictions between estimations by archaeologist and results of studies.

sen.j: 天皇陵の呼称はあくまで便宜的な名称であり、現在学問的に実証されたものではない。
sen.e: Names of the Emperor's tomb are expediencies and they are not substantiated academically.
Names of the Emperor's tombs are expediencies and not substantiated academically.
Names of the Emperor's tombs are expediencies and not substantiated academically.

sen.j: 宮内庁は、陵墓の学術調査を規制していたが、2007年1月より陵墓管理の内規を改め、限定的な調査を認めている。
sen.e: Imperial Household Agency used to restrict academic investigation of Imperial mausoleums, bylaw of Imperial mausoleum custody was altered and partial investigations are allowed today.

The Imperial Household Agency used to restrict academic investigations of Imperial mausoleums. Bylaws of Imperial mausoleum control were altered after January 2007, and limited investigations are presently allowed.

The Imperial Household Agency used to restrict academic investigations of Imperial mausoleums, but laws of Imperial mausoleum control were altered after January 2007, and limited investigations are presently allowed.
sen.cmt: Bylawsの部分を修正し、一訳文となるように致しました。

sen.j: 調査が規制されていることに関して、英語圏のメディアにおいては、宮内庁が陵墓指定古墳の調査を認めない理由は天皇家が朝鮮半島出身である証拠を公けにしたくないからであるとする説がある。
sen.e: About the restrictions of investigation, mass media in English-speaking countries says that Imperial Household Agency refuses investigations of Kofun designated as Imperial mausoleum, because Imperial family try to hid evidences to show that they are originally from Korean Peninsula.

Mass media in English-speaking countries say that the Imperial Household Agency refuses investigations of kofun designated as Imperial mausoleums because the Imperial Family are trying to hide evidence showing that they are originally from the Korean Peninsula.

Mass media in English-speaking countries say that the Imperial Household Agency refuses investigations of kofun designated as Imperial mausoleums because the Imperial Family are trying to hide evidence showing that they are originally from the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 環境の影響という面でも高松塚古墳壁画劣化の例に顕著なように、外部者が持ち込んだ物が汚染を招くという事態が多くなっている。
sen.e: Regarding environmental condition, substances brought by outsider can result in exposure, the case of the deteriorated wall painting of Takamatsuzuka Kofun was known as an example.

Regarding environmental condition, cases of substances being brought by outsiders resulting in exposure are increasing, and the case of the deteriorated wall painting of Takamatsuzuka Kofun is a known example.

Regarding environmental condition, cases of substances being brought by outsiders resulting in exposure are increasing, and the case of the deteriorated wall painting of Takamatsuzuka Kofun is a known example.

sen.j: 観光化に伴うこうした例は地域振興と密着しているため根絶を求めるのは難しく、古墳や景観の保護のためできるだけ環境負荷を最小限に留めるのが今後の課題となっている。
sen.e: Those examples and issues are closely related to regional promotion and there is no end of this kind of problem, there are future subjects such as minimizing environmental load to protect Kofun and landscape.
Such examples and issues are closely related to regional promotion, and there is no end to this kind of problem. Minimizing environmental stress for kofun and landscape protection are future issues.

Such examples and issues are closely related to regional promotion, and since there is no end to this kind of problem, minimizing environmental stress for kofun and landscape protection are future issues.
sen.cmt: 一訳文となるよう修正致しました。「難しく」の部分を「難しいので」といったニュアンスで訳出致しました。

sen.j: 古墳の破壊も後を絶たない。
sen.e: In addition, Kofun are continuously destroyed.
In addition, kofun are continuously destroyed.
In addition, kofun are continuously destroyed.

sen.j: 古墳時代にすでに古墳が破壊されていたことが発掘などにより明らかになっているが、これらは政治的意図と思われる。
sen.e: The destroyed Kofun in Kofun Period are discovered during excavations and considered as results of political intention.
The destroyed kofun in the Kofun period are being discovered during excavations and considered results of political intention.
Kofun which were destroyed during the Kofun period are being discovered through excavations, and they are considered as a result of political intention.
sen.cmt: より自然な流れとなるよう修正致しました。

sen.j: しかし年月が経過すると、土地使用に供するために古墳を破壊するようになった。
sen.e: However Kofun were destroyed for land use after Kofun Period.
However, kofun were destroyed for land use after the Kofun period.
However, kofun were destroyed for land use after the Kofun period.

sen.j: 古くは、平城宮建設のために市庭古墳（平城天皇陵）の一部などが破壊された。
sen.e: A part of Ichiniwa Kofun (burial mound of Emperor Heizei) was destroyed during construction of Heijo-kyu palace in ancient time.
A part of Ichiniwa Kofun (burial mound of Emperor Heizei) was destroyed during the construction of Heijo-kyu Palace in ancient times.
A part of Ichiniwa Kofun (burial mound of Emperor Heizei) was destroyed during the construction of Heijo-kyu Palace in ancient times.

sen.j: 農地のための破壊は歴史を通じて見られ、中世には城砦のために、近代（特に戦後）には宅地のために破壊されてきた。
sen.e: Kofun were continuously destroyed for agricultural land, in the Middle Ages Kofun were destroyed to built fortresses and in modern times Kofun are destroyed for residential land (especially after WWⅡ).

Kofun were continuously destroyed for agricultural land, and in the Middle Ages, kofun were destroyed to build fortresses. In modern times, kofun are destroyed for residential land (especially after World War 2).

Throughout history, kofun were continuously destroyed for agricultural land; in the Middle Ages, kofun were destroyed to build fortresses, and in modern times, kofun are destroyed for residential land (especially after World War II).
sen.cmt: 一訳文となるよう修正致しました。また、「歴史を通じて見られ」が訳出されていなかったため、追記致しました。また、用語統一に基づき、World War 2を修正致しました。

sen.j: 戦後に破壊された最大の古墳は、1949年に破壊された全長168mの百舌鳥大塚山古墳である。
sen.e: The biggest Kofun destroyed after WWⅡwas Mozuotsukayama Kofun which was destroyed in 1949, the entire length was 168 meters.
The biggest kofun destroyed after World War 2 was Mozuotsukayama Kofun which was destroyed in 1949. The entire length was 168 meters.
The biggest kofun destroyed after World War II was Mozuotsukayama Kofun which was destroyed in 1949, that had the entire length of 168 meters.
sen.cmt: 一訳文となるよう修正致しました。更に用語統一に基づき、World War 2を修正致しました。

sen.j: 破壊の危機に瀕したいたすけ古墳の保存運動などをきっかけに、古墳は保存すべき文化財との認識が広まり、近年では大規模な破壊はない。
sen.e: In resent years there is no major destruction of Kofun, because of preservation activity of Itasuke Kofun, people share recognition that Kofun should be preserved.
In recent years, there has been no major destruction of kofun because of preservation activities of Itasuke Kofun, and people share recognition that kofun should be preserved.
In recent years, there has been no major destruction of kofun because of preservation activities of Itasuke Kofun, and people share recognition that kofun should be preserved.

sen.j: しかし、工事の最中に発見された小さな古墳が公にされないまま破壊されている可能性があるほか、2005年には古江古墳が破壊されるなど、小規模の古墳の破壊は今もある。
sen.e: However there is some cases of minor destructions of Kofun such as the incident that Hurue Kofun was destroyed in 2005, there is also possibility that minor Kofun are secretly destroyed during constructions.

However, there have been some cases of minor destruction of kofun such as the incident in which Hurue Kofun was destroyed in 2005. There is also the possibility that minor kofun are secretly destroyed during construction.

However, there have been some cases of minor destruction of kofun such as the incident in which Hurue Kofun was destroyed in 2005, and here is also the possibility that minor kofun are secretly destroyed during construction.
sen.cmt: 一訳文となるよう修正致しました。

sen.j: 一般に遺跡の名称は、その所在地の大字（おおあざ）や小字（こあざ）を付けることを原則にしている。
sen.e: Essentially, remains are named after oaza (an administrative unit) or koaza (small administrative unit of a village) of the location.
Essentially, the remains are named after oaza (an administrative unit) or koaza (small administrative unit of a village) of the location.
Essentially, the remains are named after oaza (an administrative unit) or koaza (small administrative unit of a village) of the location.

sen.j: 例えば、登呂遺跡とか唐古・鍵遺跡などがそうである。
sen.e: Toro Ruins and Karako-Kagi Site are examples.
Toro Ruins and Karako-Kagi Site are such examples.
Toro Ruins and Karako-Kagi Site are such examples.

sen.j: 古墳も例外ではないが、古墳自体に「○×塚」、「○×山」などの名称がもともと付いていることが多く、字名も同じである場合が多い。
sen.e: Kofun is also named after oaza or koaza of the location but Kofun usually have own name as mountain or tumulus at the time of discovery and those names are the same as aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) of the location.

Kofun are also usually named after a mountain or tumulus at the time of discovery, and such names are the same as the aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) of the location.
sen.cmt: Wording. Please check that this translation is correct.
sen.e: Kofun are also usually named after a mountain or tumulus at the time of discovery, and such names are the same as the aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) of the location.

sen.j: しかし、単に八幡山、稲荷山、大塚山、茶臼山、車塚、船山、宮山などと称する地名は各地にいくらでもみられ、時には同郡、同国内に複数存在する場合もあるので、どこの八幡山かを区別するために、井辺八幡山古墳、埼玉稲荷山古墳、江田船山古墳、百舌鳥大塚山古墳などと大字またはそれより上位の地名を付して呼称するのが通例である。
sen.e: However there are many different places with the same name across Japan, for example Hachiman-yama mountain, Inari-yama mountain, Otsuka-yama mountain, Chausu-yama mountain, Kuruma-zuka tumulus, Funa-yama mountain and Miya-yama mountain, those names exist at many places and sometimes there are exactly the same names in a county or within an area of old province, to distinguish the difference, in those cases usually the name of oaza or higher rank names (such as prefecture name) will be put on the original names, for example Inbehachimanyama Kofun Inariyama Kofun, the Eta Funayama Kofun and Mozuotsukayama Kofun.

However, there are many different places with the same name across Japan, for example Hachiman-yama mountain, Inari-yama mountain, Otsuka-yama mountain, Chausu-yama mountain, Kuruma-zuka tumulus, Funa-yama mountain and Miya-yama mountain. These names exist in many places and sometimes there are exactly the same names in a county or within an area of an old province. To distinguish the difference in those cases, usually the name of the oaza or higher rank names (such as the prefecture name) will be added to the original names, for example Inbehachiman-yama mountain Kofun, Inari-yama mountain Kofun, the Eta Funa-yama mouintain Kofun and Mozuotsuka-yama mountain Kofun.

However, there are many different places with the same name across Japan, for example Hachiman-yama mountain, Inari-yama mountain, Otsuka-yama mountain, Chausu-yama mountain, Kuruma-zuka tumulus, Funa-yama mountain and Miya-yama mountain, and these names exist in many places and sometimes there are exactly the same names in a county or within an area of an old province; therefore, to distinguish the difference in those cases, usually the name of the oaza or higher rank names (such as the prefecture name) will be added to the original names, for example Inbehachiman-yama mountain Kofun, Inari-yama mountain Kofun, the Eta Funa-yama mountain Kofun and Mozuotsuka-yama mountain Kofun.
sen.cmt: 一訳文になるよう修正致しました。また、Funa-yama後のmountainの綴りを修正致しました。

sen.j: 壱岐市では掛木古墳や平山古墳など、元々の土地の所有者の名字を古墳名につけると言う特殊な例も見られる。
sen.e: In Iki city, there are Kofun named after family names of land owners, for examples Kakegi Kofun and Hirayama Kofun are particular cases.
In Iki city, there are kofun named after family names of land owners, such as Kakegi Kofun and Hirayama Kofun.
In Iki city, there are kofun named after family names of land owners, such as Kakegi Kofun and Hirayama Kofun.

sen.j: ゴーランドの研究
sen.e: Study by Gowland
Study by William Gowland
Study by William Gowland

sen.j: 古墳研究において業績を残した外国人に、イギリス人ウィリアム・ゴーランド（William Gowland）がいる。
sen.e: There was a foreigner who contributed to study of Kofun in Japan, his name is William Gowland.
There was a foreigner by the name of William Gowland who has contributed to the study of Kofun in Japan.
There was a foreigner by the name of William Gowland who has contributed to the study of Kofun in Japan.

sen.j: 彼は、造幣局の鎔銅担当技師として招聘され、後に局長顧問を兼ねた。
sen.e: He was invited as specialist of method of melting copper and worked at Mint Bureau and later he was appointed as an adviser of the chief of Mint Bureau.
He was invited as a specialist of melting copper methods and worked at the Mint Bureau and later appointed as an adviser to the chief of the Mint Bureau.
He was invited as a specialist of melting copper methods and worked at the Mint Bureau and later appointed as an adviser to the chief of the Mint Bureau.

sen.j: 彼は、1872（明治5）年から1888（明治21）年の16年間の滞日中に、本務の余暇をみてはこつこつと古墳研究を進めていた。
sen.e: In 16 years from 1872 to 1888 in Japan, he gradually advanced his research of Kofun in his spare time.
In the 16 years from 1872 to 1888 in Japan, Gowland gradually advanced his research of kofun in his spare time.
In the 16 years from 1872 to 1888 in Japan, Gowland gradually advanced his research of kofun in his spare time.

sen.j: 彼の古墳研究のことは当時、日本人の間ではほとんど知られていなかった。
sen.e: At that time his study was not known among Japanese.
However, his study was not known among Japanese at that time.
However, his study was not known among Japanese at that time.

sen.j: 彼が帰国してから『日本のドルメンと古墳』（The Dolmens and Burial Mounds in Japan,1897）と『日本のドルメンとその築造者』（The Dolmens of Japan and their Builders,1889）とを発表した。
sen.e: After he came back to England, he published "The Dolmens and Burial Mounds in Japan,1897" and "The Dolmens of Japan and their Builders,1889".
After he went back to England, he published "The Dolmens and Burial Mounds in Japan, 1897" and "The Dolmens of Japan and their Builders, 1889".
After he went back to England, he published "The Dolmens and Burial Mounds in Japan, 1897" and "The Dolmens of Japan and their Builders, 1889."
sen.cmt: ピリオドが「""」内に収まるよう修正致しました。

sen.j: 日本の古墳の中でも特に彼を引きつけたのは、巨石を使って構築された横穴式石室であった。
sen.e: For him the most attractive points of Kofun in Japan were horizontal stone chambers which are built with massive rocks.
The most attractive points of Kofun in Japan for Gowland were horizontal stone chambers which are built with massive rocks.
The most attractive points of Kofun in Japan for Gowland were horizontal stone chambers which are built with massive rocks.

sen.j: 彼が調査した横穴式石室は460で、そのうち実測図を作成してデータを計測したのは130である。
sen.e: He investigated 460 of horizontal stone chambers and calculated the data of 130 of them by making survey maps.
He investigated 460 horizontal stone chambers and calculated the data of 130 of them by making survey maps.
He investigated 460 horizontal stone chambers and calculated the data of 130 of them by making survey maps.

sen.j: 調査地域は九州から関東の15府県に渡っている。
sen.e: His study region was quite wide and he investigated in areas from Kyushu to Kanto and 15 prefectures.
His study region was quite wide and he investigated areas in 15 prefectures, from Kyushu to the Kanto region.
His study region was quite wide and he investigated areas in 15 prefectures, from Kyushu to the Kanto region.
